entry.original: A red hat may improve your head, as well as your fashion sense. (#1)
entry.edited: A red hat may improve your head, as well as your fashion sense. (#1)

entry.original: You will soon be visited by a mustachioed man. (#2)
entry.edited: You will soon be visited by a mustachioed man. (#2)

entry.original: The land is in great peril, and soon you will be the Hero of ��. (#3)
entry.edited: The land is in great peril, and soon you will be the Hero of ��. (#3)

entry.original: She who wears armor today is she who may wear armor tomorrow. (#46)
entry.edited: She who wears armor today is she who may wear armor tomorrow. (#46)

entry.original: Sometimes treasure is not hidden. It is only invisible. (#5)
entry.edited: Sometimes treasure is not hidden. It is only invisible. (#5)

entry.original: A door that does not open is not closed to you; it only needs a key. (#49)
entry.edited: A door that does not open is not closed to you; it only needs a key. (#49)

entry.original: She who shades herself from an angry sun does so with dignity. (#7)
entry.edited: She who shades herself from an angry sun does so with dignity. (#7)

entry.original: A green hat may be just the thing to inspire you toward adventure. (#8)
entry.edited: A green hat may be just the thing to inspire you toward adventure. (#8)

entry.original: If you leave my mask out there, something terrible will happen! (#9)
entry.edited: If you leave my mask out there, something terrible will happen! (#9)

entry.original: She who forgoes a hat and grabs a helmet knows not the sting of lava. (#10)
entry.edited: She who forgoes a hat and grabs a helmet knows not the sting of lava. (#10)

entry.original: Look to the sky when the sun sets. All will be revealed in this twilight. (#11)
entry.edited: Look to the sky when the sun sets. All will be revealed in this twilight. (#11)

entry.original: In both life and love, there is always another castle. (#12)
entry.edited: In both life and love, there is always another castle. (#12)

entry.original: He who plays with fire would be wise to be flame retardant. (#13)
entry.edited: He who plays with fire would be wise to be flame retardant. (#13)

entry.original: Breathing underwater is rather easy, assuming you have gills. (#14)
entry.edited: Breathing underwater is rather easy, assuming you have gills. (#14)

entry.original: Some people shy away from bombs, but you are not some people. (#15)
entry.edited: Some people shy away from bombs, but you are not some people. (#15)

entry.original: Sometimes a sword is just a sword. And sometimes it's a pretty girl. (#50)
entry.edited: Sometimes a sword is just a sword. And sometimes it's a pretty girl. (#50)

entry.original: He who breaks bricks with his head must remember to grow up. (#17)
entry.edited: He who breaks bricks with his head must remember to grow up. (#17)

entry.original: You cannot put a value on your life, unless you have 100 gold coins. (#18)
entry.edited: You cannot put a value on your life, unless you have 100 gold coins. (#18)

entry.original: He who flaps in front of an enemy may soon be flapping at his boots. (#19)
entry.edited: He who flaps in front of an enemy may soon be flapping at his boots. (#19)

entry.original: Sometimes a flower is just a flower, unless it causes fires. (#20)
entry.edited: Sometimes a flower is just a flower, unless it causes fires. (#20)

entry.original: He who wishes to grow big would be wise to eat his roughage. (#21)
entry.edited: He who wishes to grow big would be wise to eat his roughage. (#21)

entry.original: He who kicks his problems away may soon find them returning. (#22)
entry.edited: He who kicks his problems away may soon find them returning. (#22)

entry.original:
Power is often fleeting.
(#23)
entry.edited:
Power is often fleeting.
(#23)

entry.original: You only live once, unless you have another guy. (#24)
entry.edited: You only live once, unless you have another guy. (#24)

entry.original: The future is a mystery that may hold great treasures for you. (#25)
entry.edited: The future is a mystery that may hold great treasures for you. (#25)

entry.original: There are no shortcuts in life, except for when there are. (#26)
entry.edited: There are no shortcuts in life, except for when there are. (#26)

entry.original: He who leaps over fire does so knowing the fire isn't impressed. (#27)
entry.edited: He who leaps over fire does so knowing the fire isn't impressed. (#27)

entry.original: Cannons are much like toasters, though bread is bad for cannons. (#28)
entry.edited: Cannons are much like toasters, though bread is bad for cannons. (#28)

entry.original: Never count your Yoshis before they hatch. Plans often change. (#29)
entry.edited: Never count your Yoshis before they hatch. Plans often change. (#29)

entry.original: Those who slip are often just given a chance to appreciate the ground. (#48)
entry.edited: Those who slip are often just given a chance to appreciate the ground. (#48)

entry.original: Sometimes that which protects you must also fight for you as well. (#31)
entry.edited: Sometimes that which protects you must also fight for you as well. (#31)

entry.original: You should consider a career as a professional kart racer. (#32)
entry.edited: You should consider a career as a professional kart racer. (#32)

entry.original: Value the friends you have, for one day you may need them. (#33)
entry.edited: Value the friends you have, for one day you may need them. (#33)

entry.original: When all else fails, never forget to show them your moves. (#34)
entry.edited: When all else fails, never forget to show them your moves. (#34)

entry.original: It's dangerous to go alone. Take this. (#35)
entry.edited: It's dangerous to go alone. Take this. (#35)

entry.original: Your friends need you. They always need you. They will never stop. (#36)
entry.edited: Your friends need you. They always need you. They will never stop. (#36)

entry.original: He who believes he has a pure heart is probably just a beast in denial. (#37)
entry.edited: He who believes he has a pure heart is probably just a beast in denial. (#37)

entry.original: Wise men say the brain is a terrible thing to waste. (#47)
entry.edited: Wise men say the brain is a terrible thing to waste. (#47)

entry.original: Sometimes a seemingly bad instance can become a great opportunity. (#39)
entry.edited: Sometimes a seemingly bad instance can become a great opportunity. (#39)

entry.original: I see much red in your future. Much red indeed. (#40)
entry.edited: I see much red in your future. Much red indeed. (#40)

entry.original: Exercising is not a hobby. It is a lifestyle. (#41)
entry.edited: Exercising is not a hobby. It is a lifestyle. (#41)

entry.original: She who wears lava-proof pants is dressed for any occasion. (#42)
entry.edited: She who wears lava-proof pants is dressed for any occasion. (#42)

entry.original: She who wears laceless shoes is probably busy with space monsters. (#43)
entry.edited: She who wears laceless shoes is probably busy with space monsters. (#43)

entry.original: Garlic is not a substitute for personal hygiene. (#44)
entry.edited: Garlic is not a substitute for personal hygiene. (#44)

entry.original: An itchy nose is worth the sacrifice for a glorious upper lip. (#45)
entry.edited: An itchy nose is worth the sacrifice for a glorious upper lip. (#45)

entry.original: Today is not your day. Tomorrow doesn't look any better. (#4)
entry.edited: Today is not your day. Tomorrow doesn't look any better. (#4)

entry.original: It always rains on your birthday, yet no one ever gives you an umbrella. (#38)
entry.edited: It always rains on your birthday, yet no one ever gives you an umbrella. (#38)

entry.original: Sundaes are delicious every day of the week, unless you hate ice cream. (#30)
entry.edited: Sundaes are delicious every day of the week, unless you hate ice cream. (#30)

entry.original: He who stubs his toe is he who remembers his feet are there. (#6)
entry.edited: He who stubs his toe is he who remembers his feet are there. (#6)

entry.original: A bulb in your future is looking dim. Bring a flashlight. (#16)
entry.edited: A bulb in your future is looking dim. Bring a flashlight. (#16)
